intro: Astragalus babacianum, commonly known as the Babacian milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It plays a role in soil stabilization and supports local pollinators. Its seeds are often dispersed by wind, contributing to its distribution across its native range.
